display_asset.caption: Brandon Sherrod and his Yale teammates celebrated their Ivy League title with a win over Columbia last week. Next year, a similar performance will earn a No. 1 seed in the league’s postseason tournament.

summaries.body: As the lone holdout in Division I, the Ivy League announced that next year it will begin holding men's and women's postseason basketball tournaments.

display_asset.caption: Nadya V. Savchenko delivered her final statement to the court in the southern Russian town of Donetsk, on Wednesday.

summaries.body: A Ukrainian military pilot being held in Moscow ended a hunger strike by drinking water, her lawyer said, adding that she may have been tricked by Russian intelligence agents.

A lawsuit accuses the dean of the University of California, Berkeley, law school of sexually harassing his executive assistant, and says the school didn't take appropriate action after an investigation found her claims justified.

display_asset.caption: Lana Wachowski, left, in 2012 with her sibling and filmmaking partner, then known as Andy Wachowski but now known as Lilly.

summaries.body: Lilly Wachowski, one half of the film-directing duo who created “The Matrix” series, came out as a transgender woman. Her sister also came out as transgender in 2012.

display_asset.caption: The cache of weapons and fake law enforcement identification cards that the authorities say they recovered from Lee Bergman’s apartment in Queens.

summaries.body: A Queens man is accused of amassing an "arsenal of deadly weapons" in his apartment, which was searched after investigators discovered he had bought four forged Police Department identification cards.

display_asset.caption: Curtis Jackson, the rapper known as 50 Cent, arrived for a federal bankruptcy court hearing in Hartford on Wednesday.

summaries.body: The rapper 50 Cent, who filed for bankruptcy protection last year, told the court that the money he posed with in Instagram photos was fake.

display_asset.caption: John H. Gutfreund, seated, with Michael R. Bloomberg, the future mayor of New York, at Salomon Brothers in 1975. Mr. Gutfreund later rose to head the firm as Wall Street was in ascendancy.

summaries.body: John Gutfreund, who ran Salomon Brothers at its apex in the 1980s but was later driven from Wall Street by scandal, has died at 86.
Dos Equis is retiring its current "most interesting man in the world" after roughly nine years of beer ads. Company officials say the campaign will live on with a new actor.

display_asset.caption: Fumigating a home for the mosquito that carries the Zika virus in Recife, Brazil, last month.
display_asset.credit: Mauricio Lima for The New York Times

summaries.body: Despite efforts to speed up development, a vaccine to combat the Zika virus is years away, the World Health Organization said.

display_asset.caption: New Jersey Transit increased warnings to riders as the Sunday deadline approached for the agency’s first rail strike in 33 years.
display_asset.credit: Brian Harkin for The New York Times

summaries.body: New Jersey Transit is warning commuters and New York businesses are preparing for the worst as a potential strike looms.

display_asset.caption: NASA is aiming to launch its InSight spacecraft in May 2018.

summaries.body: A NASA mission to probe beneath the surface of Mars that was delayed for two years because of technical problems has been rescheduled for May 2018.
Abigail Kopf, 14, was shot in the head during a rampage in Michigan last month and was declared dead. But she survived, and she was released from the hospital this week.

display_asset.caption: Pablo A. Serrano-Vitorino
display_asset.credit: Montgomery County Jail, via Associated Press

summaries.body: A Mexican man accused of killing five people should have been jailed or deported last year, officials said, but he was allowed to go free three times because of procedural errors.

display_asset.caption: At a news conference on Wednesday, Mayor Ras J. Baraka of Newark said water in the city was safe and drinkable.

summaries.body: The Newark school district, New Jersey’s largest, shut off water fountains in 30 buildings until more tests could be conducted about why lead levels were so high.

display_asset.caption: The solar eclipse formed a “diamond ring” over Indonesia.

summaries.body: Thousands across the world watched the total solar eclipse on Wednesday. It produced captivating images.

display_asset.caption: Padma Lakshmi at the amfAR gala in New York City in February.

summaries.body: Padma Lakshmi, the cookbook author and "Top Chef" host, opens up about her former husband Salman Rushdie in a 324-page memoir about love, fame and food.

display_asset.caption: The killer whale Tilikum with SeaWorld Orlando trainers at the theme park in Florida in 2011. The orca has been found to have a respiratory disease.

summaries.body: The killer whale who became the focus of the documentary "Blackfish" has a respiratory disease that could likely end in death, his caretakers at SeaWorld said.

display_asset.caption: The invention of cooking significantly contributed to early humans’ development, but using stone tools to merely break down food into smaller pieces may also have helped, a new study concluded.
display_asset.credit: Juli Leonard/Raleigh News & Observer, via Getty

summaries.body: How did our ancestors evolve from small-brained, big-jawed apes into large-brained, small-jawed humans? Scientists performed an unappetizing experiment to find out.

display_asset.caption: Representative Tammy Duckworth, Democrat of Illinois, lost both of her legs when her helicopter was hit by a rocket-propelled grenade in 2004.

summaries.body: A Republican committee deleted its Twitter post that said Tammy Duckworth, an Iraq veteran and double amputee, has a “sad record of not standing up for our veterans.”
Women who make the first move in online dating​ are rewarded with more desirable men, according to an OkCupid study of 70,000 users.

display_asset.caption: Firefighters at the scene of a building explosion in Seattle early Wednesday.

summaries.body: An overnight explosion in Seattle leveled two buildings and injured at least nine firefighters. A natural gas leak was confirmed as the cause.

display_asset.caption: Coverage of the Go master Lee Se-dol’s loss to Google DeepMind’s AlphaGo in the first match of the best-of-five series in Seoul, South Korea, on Wednesday.
display_asset.credit: Yonhap News Agency, via European Pressphoto Agency

summaries.body: A Google computer trounced one of the world’s top players in a round of Go, which is believed to be the most complex board game ever created.

display_asset.caption: Shruthi Aramandla, 24, a native of India who received a master’s degree in engineering from New York University in May, said she would be able to stay longer in the United States under the new rule.

summaries.body: International students earning degrees in science and technology fields in the United States will now be eligible to stay for three years of on-the-job training.

display_asset.caption: A crowd gathered in Jakarta, Indonesia’s capital, on Wednesday to observe the total solar eclipse, which was visible in nearly half of the country’s 34 provinces.

summaries.body: Millions of Indonesians witnessed a total solar eclipse early on Wednesday, the first since March 20 of last year.
For all the urgent issues President Obama is facing, his health doesn't appear to be one of them. Tests showed a lower weight and an improved heart rate compared with 2014.
“Hostel-like” hotels may be part of Hilton’s strategy as the company tries to attract young travelers seeking cheaper rooms.

display_asset.caption: Cyrena Lee, in front of the Whole Foods Market in Gowanus, Brooklyn. Solar energy is in keeping with the company’s image, but it will also save the company money.
display_asset.credit: Dolly Faibyshev for The New York Times

summaries.body: Whole Foods is planning to install about 100 rooftop solar power systems to reduce costs as it faces increasing competition from other stores selling organic goods.

display_asset.caption: Times Square is a top attraction for tourists in New York City, but officials hope to lure visitors to explore the city’s other boroughs.

summaries.body: New York City’s tourism agency is forecasting a record 59.7 million visitors in 2016. Last year, England, Canada and Brazil sent the most foreign visitors.

display_asset.caption: Shaun Cunningham saved his son Landon from a flying bat during a spring training game in Florida on Saturday.

summaries.body: A flying baseball bat, a dad’s instinct and a photograph. In a split second, a risky moment became a picture that has dazzled the Internet.
John Oliver sold out of “Make Donald Drumpf Again" caps after the presidential candidate became the focus of his show, "Last Week Tonight."
